did.abstract: William Blum (1933-2018) was an author, historian, and former employee of the United States Department of State. Blum left his government position in 1967 because of his opposition to United States involvement in Vietnam, and became one of the founders and editors of the Washington Free Press, an alternative bi-weekly newspaper. As a freelance journalist, Blum frequently wrote about the CIA and the agency's involvement with foreign governments. He spent 1972-1973 in Chile where he reported on Salvador Allende's presidency. The William Blum Papers (dated 1965-2018) consists of materials created and collected by Blum documenting his career as a critic of United States foreign policy. The bulk of this collection consists of Blum's research files on the CIA, with particular emphasis on the agency's involvement with foreign governments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The William Blum Papers (dated 1965-2018) consists of materials created and collected by William Blum documenting his career as an author, historian, and critic of United States foreign policy. The bulk of this collection consists of Blum's research files on the CIA, with particular emphasis on the agency's involvement with foreign governments. This collection also includes video recordings of documentaries about the CIA.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and described on the collection-level with a box-list. Born-digital items were identified, physically separated, and inventoried. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
